review_title: Relaxed work environment with good communication between departments
job_title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist in Collingwood, ON
pros:
+Balanced workload
+Temperature is well-controlled
+Pleasant coworkers
+Room to cross-train in different disciplines
cons:
-Not much offered in cafeteria
-That's all I can think of

pros: Good job if there wasn't bullying
cons:
Major bullying and lack of support from management. 
Management keeps bad staff which discourages good people from applying and is why their turnaround is so high. 
Training is a joke and nonexistent.

pros: job security and remote work opportunity
cons: lack of growth opportunities beyond current role

pros: Small hospital- majority of staff know each other, creating a close interdisciplinary team environment. Lots of hours available to work. Excellent environment service team, high touch areas cleaned frequently & all new COVID-19 cleaning protocols carefully followed. Highly trained senior nursing staff. Supportive physicians willing to help teach nursing staff, as well as excellent resident physicians. Physicians, resident physicians & nursing team members work collaboratively in this rural hospital to deliver fast & effective patient care.
cons: Lack of support from hospital administration/general lack of presence, "sink or swim" nursing environment (due to frequent staffing shortages, sub-par mental health support for inpatients & especially staff. Poor training to new hired employees in comparison to other facilities (in regard to nursing).

job_title: Registered Nurse in Wasaga Beach, ON
pros:
Busy, and interesting work. 
Tourist town
cons:
Quick staff turn around 
Quick management turn around

review_title: There's no easy way to say this, it's just bad
pros: Majority of the people that work here are wonderful people who are excellent to work with.
cons:
Managerial incompetence, especially at the higher levels. They are very disconnected from reality and chasing their own personal goals, oftentimes butting heads with each other. 
Financial irresponsibility; loads of money for fancy swipe badges and painting the walls "calming" colors, while skimping on the essentials - the people.
A revolving door of CEO's that ensures the political strife among management won't be solved soon
Nightmare of a redevelopment project almost entirely opposed by the town.
Cell phone signal sucks
